conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during deceleration.
Deceleration phase for particle A is from t = t0 to t = 2t0.
Deceleration phase for particle B is from t = 4t0 to t = 6t0.
Initial velocity for particle A at t = t0 is 2v0.
Final velocity for particle A at t = 2t0 is 0.
Initial velocity for particle B at t = 4t0 is v0.
Final velocity for particle B at t = 6t0 is 0.
Calculate acceleration for particle A: a_A = -2v0/t0.
Calculate acceleration for particle B: a_B = -v0/2t0.
Calculate the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration: Ratio = 4.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during deceleration is 4:1.
